intro: Sphaerocephalus hebelepis, commonly known as the globe-headed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit and features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Sphaerocephalus hebelepis thrives in well-drained, sandy or loamy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance once established.
